messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Body Music
messages.msgSnippet: ***My son watched with me and immediately started to move and make rhythm and sound. Everything in sight became an instrument, including the different sounds
messages.messageBody:
***My son watched with me and immediately started to move and make rhythm
and sound. Everything in sight became an instrument, including the
different sounds of gentle backside-pats on all of our pets! Very fun
and inspiring, takes creativity into wonderful realms....***
 
He might also enjoy this... http://www.stomponline.com/
 
They do fantastic shows!

messages.subject: Body Music
messages.msgSnippet: I heard this program while driving yesterday  http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=97824969 and was absolutely fascinated!  A great listen for
messages.messageBody:
I heard this program while driving yesterday http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=97824969
and was absolutely fascinated! A great listen for music lovers and
very interesting also in a cultural/anthropological type of way.

I came home and found these also (they are shorter):

http://www.crosspulse.com/html/aboutkt.html


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GhkwluJsElw&NR=1

My son watched with me and immediately started to move and make rhythm
and sound. Everything in sight became an instrument, including the
different sounds of gentle backside-pats on all of our pets! Very fun
and inspiring, takes creativity into wonderful realms....

Deanna








[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
